definition.name: NXcg_ellipsoid_set

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: d
symbol.doc: The dimensionality, which has to be at least 2.

symbol.name: c
symbol.doc: The cardinality of the set, i.e. the number of ellipses, or ellipsoids.

definition.doc:
Computational geometry description of a set of ellipsoids in Euclidean space.
Individual ellipsoids can have different half axes.

field.name: identifier_offset
field.doc:
Integer which specifies the first index to be used for distinguishing identifiers for ellipsoids. Identifiers are defined either implicitly or explicitly. For implicit indexing the identifiers are defined on the interval [identifier_offset, identifier_offset+c-1]. For explicit indexing the identifier array has to be defined.
The identifier_offset field can for example be used to communicate if the identifiers are expected to start from 1 (referred to as Fortran-/Matlab-) or from 0 (referred to as C-, Python-style index notation) respectively.

field.name: identifier
field.doc: Integer used to distinguish ellipsoids for explicit indexing.

field.name: center
field.doc: Geometric center of the ellipsoids. This can be the center of mass. Dimensionality and cardinality of the point and ellipsoid set have to match. The identifier_offset and identifier field of NXcg_point_set do not need to be used as they should be same as the identifier_offset and the identifier for the ellipsoids.

field.name: half_axes_radius
field.doc: If all ellipsoids in the set have the same half-axes.

field.name: half_axes_radii
field.doc: In the case that ellipsoids have different radii use this field instead of half_axes_radius.

group.doc: Reference to or definition of a coordinate system with which the positions and directions are interpretable.

field.name: is_closed
field.doc: Are the ellipsoids closed or hollow?

field.name: orientation
field.doc: Direction unit vector which points along the largest half-axes.
